byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from London, and Eric Schmitt from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Russia's buildup of air-defense systems as well as combat aircraft in Syria has raised concerns that it intends to establish military outpost in Middle East, rather than merely contributing in fight against Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The deployment of air defense systems and fighter aircraft has spurred concerns that Moscow’s goal includes establishing a military outpost in the Middle East.

headline.main: Russian Buildup in Syria Raises Questions on Role
headline.print_headline: Russian Buildup in Syria Raises Questions on Role

snippet: The deployment of air defense systems and fighter aircraft has spurred concerns that Moscow’s goal includes establishing a military outpost in the Middle East.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
